content: works for me
Works for me as well. I'm gonna spend free time next week on Souffle integration. Hopefully I can get a prototype of .next working before the next sprint.
created calendar event
Thanks! I didn't have much free time last week, but I should still be able to get everything up and running before the next sprint.

I'm in the same boat, between moving and deadlines at $work, I didn't have much free time either during the last couple weeks. I've been trying to dive into .next (especially to see how to generate the facts we need) this week
are we still up for this coming sprint though?
my personal plan is to extend https://github.com/nikomatsakis/polonius.next/
I wanted to create a real parser for a simple language that encodes the rules
so we can write examples
it looks like dylan and I are up for the sprint for sure :)

nikomatsakis said:

so we can write examples

if we could generate the facts we need easily, we'd be able to try it for real. either just using soufflé as we have been doing, or with dylan's soufflé integration prototype and a simple variant -- directly with rustc. we could do that during the sprint as well, of course

nikomatsakis said:

are we still up for this coming sprint though?

I'm in for sure.

nikomatsakis said:

I wanted to create a real parser for a simple language that encodes the rules

Just let me know what I can do to be maximally helpful.

Part of the reason I was interested in Souffle was to experiment with a basic block-aware version of live/init, which needed arithmetic predicates, dense relations (radix tries), and disjunction/inlining. I wanted to be able to run the rustc test suite in a reasonable amount of time and evaluate which features should be ported into datafrog. Obviously liveness is no longer needed for polonius.next, so this is less important, but it still interests me. I thought it would be useful for other types of prototyping as well, since you don't need to do variable indexing yourself.
between https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/88983 and "in a reasonable amount of time" — so much shade today :joy:
for the record it's not that unreasonable today

lqd said:

between https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/88983 and "in a reasonable amount of time" — so much shade today :joy:

Sorry. To be fair, this was a while ago, on a laptop, and I was writing huge .fact files and swapping like crazy (I think due to Location::All?)
I'm joking of course
there are a few tests that definitely OOM
because of Location::All indeed

lqd said:

if we could generate the facts we need easily, we'd be able to try it for real

especially the more recent "loan-less" formulation, without loan propagation and containment, which is even more experimental than the livenessless .next
Yeah, I debated about just integrating with rustc
but I think it'd be useful to have a little "mini language"
yeah a simple one using S-expressions, Racket, and leases
That is to say I'll also be around on Friday!
Or, well, let's maybe kick this off at least
For me, in 2 weeks is fine, then I'll probably not be able to attend any sprints in the two weeks after that
Can you give the date, @Domenic Quirl ?
sure
2021-10-29 would still work for me
and then after that only 2021-11-19 and later
(I don't know how to do the fancy date-in-timezone thing)
but also please don't all schedule around me :sweat_smile:
The 29th works for me as well.

I don't think I'll be able to actively participate on the 29th for most of the sprint (I'll have to work for most of its duration) but will be able to passively listen on audio, and read discussions here and there. but don't mind me go ahead with the 29th, we need to make some progress anyways ^^
I just realized this is tomorrow :)
I'm still game to do it though, we should make an event on the calendar
